decks.notes: This Izzet Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal to control the game while generating card advantage and tempo. It utilizes cards like Divide by Zero, Consider, and Stormchaser's Talent to maintain control of the board while accumulating resources. Igneous Inspiration and Combustion Technique provide additional removal options, while Accumulate Wisdom and Gran-Gran ensure consistent card advantage. The deck also includes some unique cards like Otawara, Soaring City and It'll Quench Ya! to provide versatility and unexpected plays. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient control and resource management.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and fast damage output through cheap spells and creatures. It utilizes cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics to control the board while quickly building up damage with cards like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear. The synergy between cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Reckless Rage allows for powerful removal and damage potential. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a combination of burn spells, creatures, and combat tricks to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Skyclave Apparition, while disrupting opponents with cards like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. It aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, while also having the ability to generate card advantage with cards like Collected Company and Elspeth, Storm Slayer. The mana base is designed to support the early game aggression with a mix of untapped dual lands and mana dorks. Overall, the deck seeks to apply constant pressure and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Cori-Steel Cutter, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage, coupled with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage. The deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Academic Dispute and Boomerang Basics for additional support and disruption. The inclusion of Experimental Synthesizer and Stormchaser's Talent helps provide card advantage and extra damage. Overall, this deck focuses on applying pressure and maintaining a fast tempo to secure victory.

In this Izzet Control deck, the main focus is on disrupting the opponent's plans and controlling the board through a combination of counterspells, bounce effects, and removal spells. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by drawing cards, bouncing threats back to their hand, and eventually overwhelming them with a combination of creatures and burn spells. With a mix of card advantage, efficient removal, and versatile counterspells, this deck seeks to control the pace of the game and dictate how the match unfolds in its favor.

The primary focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also removing threats with cards like Vanishing Verse and Fatal Push. The deck relies on a combination of removal spells and powerful threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to establish dominance on the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Gifted Aetherborn and Qarsi Revenant to help stabilize against aggressive strategies and to generate card advantage. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and secure a victory through careful resource management.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to ramp up mana and play powerful threats like Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Collected Company allows for quick creature deployment while Skyclave Apparition provides removal. Elspeth, Storm Slayer offers a powerful finisher, while cards like Aven Interrupter and Ouroboroid provide additional utility and disruption. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, backed up by resilient lands like Razorverge Thicket and Temple Garden.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly outpace and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage put pressure on the opponent early, while cards like Reckless Rage, Burst Lightning, and Boomerang Basics provide removal and reach to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to maintain board presence and apply constant pressure to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively by utilizing low-cost, high-impact creatures and spells to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Emberheart Challenger, and Soul-Scar Mage, while also utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and keep the pressure on. The deck's mana base also allows for smooth and efficient casting of spells, ensuring a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The main goal of this Pioneer Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early on with cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage, while also using direct damage spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage to control the board and finish off opponents. The inclusion of lands like Ramunap Ruins and Den of the Bugbear allow for additional reach and late-game finishers to secure victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them in the long game. Additionally, the deck includes cards that provide incremental advantage, such as The Wandering Emperor and Restless Anchorage, to generate value over time. The deck also includes a variety of win conditions, such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, March of Otherworldly Light, and high impact finishers like Ultima and Castle Ardenvale, ensuring that the deck can close out the game once it gains control.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption, removal spells, and controlling the board with powerful creatures like Preacher of the Schism and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. It also utilizes mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Mutavault to cast spells ahead of curve. The deck aims to maintain board control and tempo advantage while slowly grinding out the opponent's resources until it can establish a dominant position to win the game. It also includes some land destruction elements to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The focus of this deck is on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells while also establishing a board presence with creatures like Badgermole Cub and Sentinel of the Nameless City. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently removing threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan, while also utilizing powerful lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Mutavault. With a mix of hand disruption, removal, and versatile creatures, this control deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a slower, grindy game.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by using a combination of discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay, and controlling creatures like Ouroboroid and Sentinel of the Nameless City. It also utilizes lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to gain an advantage in certain situations. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and disruption.

The deck focuses on using cards that enable the player to quickly assemble a powerful combo that can overwhelm the opponent. By strategically utilizing cards like Indomitable Creativity, Deduce, and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, the player can create a strong board presence and deal massive damage in a short amount of time. The deck also includes versatile spell cards like Spell Pierce and Prismari Command to control the board and counter the opponent's moves. Overall, the deck aims to surprise and outmaneuver the opponent through its unique and creative combo plays.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse, and powerful creatures like Preacher of the Schism and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck aims to control the board state and outvalue the opponent by using efficient removal and card advantage engines. Additionally, cards like High Noon and Blade of the Oni provide additional ways to generate value and disrupt the opponent's strategy.
